intro: Othonna pavelkae, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, feathery foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine. Othonna pavelkae is also valued for its ability to attract beneficial insects and support local biodiversity.
